comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Since the version 7, the downloaded fonts are not smoothed on my website while they were smoothed on Firefox 6. I found a way to have the same render as before while setting the gfx.font_rendering.cleartype.use_for_downloadable_fonts option to false and letting gfx.font_rendering.cleartype.always_use_for_content to false but it is not really satisfying because it changes the behavior of programming. 


Actual results:

Downloaded fonts are not smoothed on FF7 / Win XP. I checked the ClearType parameters of my computer but it affects only system fonts. Downloaded fonts remain not smoothed whatever I do when the gfx.font_rendering.cleartype.use_for_downloadable_fonts option is set to true.


Expected results:

The render should not change compared to FF6. Download fonts should be smoothed when gfx.font_rendering.cleartype.use_for_downloadable_fonts is set to true.

comments.raw_text:
Sorry, it's the first time I report a bug... So here are some screenshots.

1. http://www.thrashocore.com/_tmp/bug_ff7/bug_ff7_1.jpg

ClearType : off
gfx.font_rendering.cleartype.use_for_downloadable_fonts : on

2. http://www.thrashocore.com/_tmp/bug_ff7/bug_ff7_2.jpg

ClearType : on
gfx.font_rendering.cleartype.use_for_downloadable_fonts : on or off (same rendering)

3. http://www.thrashocore.com/_tmp/bug_ff7/bug_ff7_3.jpg

ClearType : off
gfx.font_rendering.cleartype.use_for_downloadable_fonts : off

----

The third case is the good one, the render is the same as FF6. The big title is not smoothed on case 1 & 2.
If you want to see a live demo, you can go to any page of my website : http://www.thrashocore.com/.
I updated my browser at work and I encounter the same results as at home (same config, FF 7.0.1 / Win XP).

Hope it helps.
